text:
From Reno to Washington, it's always a pleasure sitting down with Sam. Find the full episode below: 

https://t.co/bneBYoop7U
https://t.co/EnHNZwqDLN

China knows lithium’s value and is dominating the supply chain. Nevada’s Thacker Pass project shows the West’s potential to lead and secure American-made energy for America.

✍️Check out my joint op-ed with @JosephMLombardo in the Washington Examiner:

https://t.co/IVvBivKMOi

ICYMI: This week, the House passed the FY26 NDAA to sharpen America’s military dominance and bolster combat readiness.

This bill delivers on our commitment to responsibly strengthen our defense capabilities, invest in our troops, and restore a peace through strength posture. https://t.co/4iGbatihFs

Please join me in reflecting on one of our nation’s darkest days, September 11, 2001. Our country, our people, and our democracy were attacked. We honor the innocent victims, heroic first responders, and families whose strength carries them forward. They will never be forgotten. https://t.co/R9A8RnHpmx

The Rosemont Decision disrupted decades of mining precedent vital to Nevada’s economy and our national security.

The Mining Regulatory Clarity Act restores the long-standing standard, giving land managers certainty to advance responsible U.S. mining over reliance on adversaries. https://t.co/Y1sAsWb7eo

This week, I toured Kraus Hamdani Aerospace’s hub in Reno to see their advanced AI-powered unmanned aircraft in action.

Their impressive technology supports our armed forces, aids disaster relief, enhances critical communications, and advances key national security priorities. https://t.co/0w0TeCVPDV

Appreciate @USChamber for bringing together some familiar faces for today’s Tax Roundtable in Carson City. 

It was great to reconnect and discuss how the OBBB’s pro-growth tax reform will drive economic momentum for small businesses and working families across #NV02. https://t.co/vwT90gpX2V

The 2025 U.S. Capitol Christmas Tree will come directly from #NV02, specifically, the Carson Ranger District of the Humboldt-Toiyabe National Forest.

This is a once-in-a-lifetime honor for our state to be featured in one of our nation’s most cherished holiday traditions.

Today marks the 235th anniversary of the United States Coast Guard. 

This multi-mission force patrols our maritime borders, responds to disasters, and defends our national security. 

Thank you to all the servicemembers of @USCG who answered the call to keep us safe! https://t.co/3u7KfIPf5z

Today, I had the honor of attending the dedication of Guinn Summit in honor of the late Kenny Guinn, Nevada’s 27th Governor. Governor Guinn was a highly respected and experienced leader who devoted his life to serving our state. 

He was always steps ahead, championing quality education, supporting seniors and working families, promoting fiscal responsibility, and advancing common-ground policies to uplift every Nevadan.

Nevada is better because of him, and it was a privilege to pay tribute to his legacy today.

Thank you to the first responders who were on scene within minutes of the active shooter report at the GSR. I’m grateful the situation has been resolved and there is no ongoing threat, thanks to the brave men and women of @RenoPolice.

Nevada, it’s our time to shine! This year’s Capitol Christmas Tree is coming from the Humboldt-Toiyabe National Forest, and we have the opportunity to help decorate it. 

So, let’s get in the Christmas spirit early and show the other 49 states how the Silver State celebrates!

See the details on how you can contribute below:

Did you know: The One Big Beautiful Bill Act delivers real relief for seniors?

✅$75 billion to help cover food, housing, and prescriptions
✅A higher standard deduction for low- and middle-income seniors
✅88% of seniors on Social Security will pay zero taxes on their benefits https://t.co/9zAtjVejIa

Did you know: The One Big Beautiful Bill Act is a big win for small businesses?

Without it, over 57,560 small businesses in #NV02 would have been pinched with a 43.4% tax rate.

This historic bill keeps the backbone of our economy strong, and their doors open. https://t.co/EpGe6cejK3

President Trump ran on a promise to restore order at the border after inheriting four years of chaos.

By passing the OBBB alongside the FY26 DHS Appropriations Bill, we’re delivering on that promise to make America more secure than ever before.

https://t.co/2ZhWGJHeu0

We can all agree, as hostile regimes and terror groups work to destabilize democracies, bold investments in our military are essential. The safety of Americans, our allies, and our troops depend on it.

@HouseGOP is delivering the resources our military needs to deter aggression, defend U.S. interests, and maintain our force’s superiority.

Did you know: The One Big Beautiful Bill Act puts working families first?

If Congress hadn’t passed it, 84,910 families in #NV02 would have seen their child tax credit cut in half. 

Instead: 
✅Incentives for paid leave and childcare
✅Trump savings accounts for newborns
✅Permanently increases the Dependent Care FSA annual limit from $5,000 to $7,500

Did you know: The claim that Trump’s tax cuts only benefited the wealthy is a myth?

Here’s the truth: After the Trump Tax Cuts, the top 1% paid more in income taxes than ever before. Meanwhile, the bottom 50% paid less than ever before.

The One Big Beautiful Bill puts more money in the pockets of Nevadans.

Did you know: The OBBB offers real solutions to Nevada’s housing challenges? 

By expanding tax credit incentives, it encourages developers to build more affordable housing for low and middle-income families.

Here in Nevada, where prices have skyrocketed and supply remains tight, this legislation is an essential step toward meeting our state’s needs and makes the dream of homeownership a reality for Nevadans.

Today, Congress will honor Greg LeMond, the first American to win the Tour de France, with a Congressional Gold Medal — one of our nation’s highest civilian awards.

Raised in Washoe Valley, he discovered his love for cycling on our state’s scenic and challenging trails.

LeMond is truly deserving of this honor, and here in Nevada, we're proud to be a small part of his incredible story. Congratulations!

https://t.co/1Xh24uXKaK

During his very first rescue mission, @USCG rescue swimmer Scott Ruskan saved 165 lives amid the devastating floods in central Texas.

Without hesitation, he jumped into danger—putting his Coast Guard training into action when it mattered most.

He and the entire crew on the ground embody the strength and bravery of our service members. We thank them for their service, and our thoughts remain with the families and communities impacted across Texas.

Happy Fourth of July, Nevada!🇺🇸🇺🇸

Today, we celebrate our nation’s 249th birthday. Stay safe and enjoy the fireworks!! https://t.co/hXrZsXOOHI

Promises Made, Promises Kept.

Today, @HouseGOP passed the historic One Big Beautiful Bill Act, delivering real relief to the American public and restoring accountability in Washington. 

Now it heads to @POTUS’s desk, just in time to celebrate Independence Day!

https://t.co/l9gyEpkMud

No action could ever fully match the sacrifice of our veterans, but this bill is a step toward the dignity and care they deserve. 

The FY26 MilConVA bill invests in those who served, and the families who stand behind them. 

✅1 of 12 appropriations bills passed. Stay tuned! https://t.co/PIuTuRMhiH

Last night, @HouseAppropsGOP passed the FY26 Homeland Security Bill, delivering on our responsibility to fund the Department that protects the Homeland.   

More info: https://t.co/2Wt4wrPdhE https://t.co/fi3VDIdhMy

Today, @HouseAppropsGOP will be marking up the FY26 Homeland Security Bill.

We were sent here by an overwhelming majority demanding real action to end the chaos at the border and restore safety in our communities. 

We are delivering on that promise:
https://t.co/LKxUpuAKxn

This is a direct result of a strong leader who restored law and order and delivered on his promises to forge a more secure homeland. The mess was ugly, and while the job isn’t done, our communities are undeniably safer than they have been in the last 4 years.

From tariff talks and the One Big Beautiful Bill to developments in the appropriations process and my perspective on Israel’s bold offensive against Iran, there’s no shortage of updates to unpack in Washington.

Read the latest edition of my newsletter:

https://t.co/Rl3BGzs3tQ

Today marks the 250th Anniversary of the U.S. Army. I’m proud to have served our country under this branch. To all the men and women who answered the same call, thank you for your service.

Go Army!🪖💪 https://t.co/JATJ0KS8PF

My Statement Following Vote on Rescissions Package: 

https://t.co/3fHJ6qrDVF

What was once policy-driven chaos under Biden, quickly turned into the lowest number of crossings in recorded history. Now, we must make investments to sustain the progress made in border security and immigration enforcement.

The FY26 Homeland Security bill does just that. https://t.co/4vU2nVdQfU

Last night, the FY26 Homeland Security Bill passed out of subcommittee which invests $66.36 billion to fund the mission of the Department that protects the Homeland.

We can never say mission accomplished in this business, but the mission is off to a strong start. https://t.co/R2bVBpLWxm
Tonight at 6 pm ET, I’ll be chairing the markup of the Fiscal Year 2026 Homeland Security Appropriations Bill. Tune in: https://t.co/WYgOZTpR9Q https://t.co/5rXG4GqsQq

As Co-Chairs of the Public Broadcasting Caucus, I joined @RepDanGoldman in urging the Trump Administration to reconsider its proposed rescissions in funding to the Corporation for Public Broadcasting. https://t.co/vQcpXxzDye
ICYMI: I sat down with Sam Shad on Nevada Newsmakers for a two-part interview covering what’s next for my land amendment and key updates from Washington. Catch both segments below:

Congratulations to Reno High alum, Luke Hobson, on breaking the U.S. Open record in the 200m freestyle! He now sits as the 5th fastest performer ever and the first American under 1:44 since 2009. 

Incredible achievement, keep up the great work!

Last week, the House passed the One Big Beautiful Bill Act which extends @POTUS 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, set to expire at the end of this year. 

This means more relief, growth, and opportunity for American families and workers—and a stronger, more stable path to prosperity. https://t.co/qJk9L0rEPY
My statement following the passage of H.R. 1, the One Big Beautiful Bill Act: https://t.co/jFChatnfKP

Every day, law enforcement officers wake up, put on the uniform, and choose to place themselves in harm’s way to protect and serve our communities.

To those committed to public service and safety, and the families who support them, thank you! #HappyNationalPoliceWeek https://t.co/bNu7b0WN06

Last week, @CISAgov Bridget Bean testified before @HouseAppropsGOP to share strategies for bolstering our cyber defenses.

China’s aggression has escalated, and we must enhance CISA’s capabilities to protect our critical infrastructure and strengthen our national security. https://t.co/OVQaGejv2D

ICYMI: I held an oversight hearing with @SecNoem to discuss the Department of Homeland Security's priorities.

They're moving at a breakneck pace to regain control of our borders, and we're committed to ensuring DHS has the resources it needs to execute its mission. https://t.co/TLOGwX7kbz
Happy 157th Birthday, Reno!!! https://t.co/OadnIs0ixl

This morning at 10 am ET, I’ll be chairing a Homeland Security oversight hearing featuring testimony from @SecNoem. We will discuss the agency’s priorities moving forward and review the progress made to date.

Watch live here:
https://t.co/o8K51Kr0X3

Beginning May 7, TSA checkpoints will require passengers 18 years and older to present a REAL ID-compliant state-issued identification or another acceptable form of ID as defined under the REAL ID Act of 2005.

For a list of FAQs and acceptable forms of identity, please visit my website below:

https://t.co/Qj0jm18TUd

Happy National Travel and Tourism Week! 

Thank you to everyone in the industry whose hard work and creativity helps make Nevada a top destination. Your contributions fuel our economy, support local businesses, and showcase the best our state has to offer. https://t.co/dK2FiWFXYM

Today, I hosted a tree dedication ceremony on the U.S. Capitol Grounds to honor the people of Nevada.

If you find yourself in Washington, D.C., I encourage you to visit this tribute symbolizing the people who make the Silver State so great! https://t.co/rqb5Ub0ehm

Congratulations to the two teams from @TheDavidsonAcad High School and Middle School for advancing to the National Finals of the 2025 National Science Bowl, presented by the Department of Energy’s Office of Science. 

The competition took place over the past few days with more than 550 students from 45 states.

Your hard work has made NV-02 proud, keep up the great work!

Happy Earth Day and National Park week!🌎

Here in Nevada, we’re lucky to be surrounded by breathtaking landscapes and incredible natural resources. It’s the perfect time to get outside and appreciate what we’ve got! https://t.co/AWqqeAnr1H

🚨Exciting news: The Nevada Museum of Art in Reno is 1 of just 10 museums nationwide selected to host permanent collections from @ngadc through the "Across the Nation" program! 

Don't miss the Dorothea Lange: Seeing People exhibit featuring iconic portraits from the 20th century, on display now through February 15, 2026.

Learn more here: https://t.co/3dJ4BtnVRw

Yesterday, I had the honor of addressing the 83rd session of the Nevada State Legislature. 

I shared updates from Washington and encouraged all members, Republicans and Democrats alike, to reach out to my office with any federal concerns. 

Strong partnerships between state and federal leaders are essential to delivering real results for Nevada.

On Gold Star Spouses Day we reflect and honor the immeasurable sacrifices made by the families of our fallen service members. 

Their support for their loved ones, who put their lives on the line to protect our freedoms, strengthens the foundation of our nation. Thank you for all that you do!

Calling all high school students from NV-02 to participate in the 2025 Congressional Art Competition for the chance for your artwork to be displayed in the U.S. Capitol!

This is a unique opportunity for students in each congressional district around the country to be recognized for their artistic talent.

For important dates and submission guidelines visit my website here: 
https://t.co/E2RsugSLkt

Today, I reintroduced the Northern Nevada Economic Development and Conservation Act which showcases the continuous effort to unlocking the potential of Nevada.

Read my full statement and learn more about the contents of this bill: https://t.co/8mH66u3hID https://t.co/Kf6cECpuv4

Yesterday, @JosephMLombardo and I visited the Lithium America Workforce Housing Hub in Winnemucca to check out the progress made.

Thacker Pass will generate more than $700 million in economic activity annually for our state.

It’s a win for Nevada’s economy and job market. https://t.co/f9pnfYAjaR

Proud to co-lead the NEDD Act, which strengthens the protection of our nuclear sites by broadening the Department of Energy’s authority to defend against threats.

We cannot stand by while unknown drones target sites critical to our national security. https://t.co/9JQyzLQQS1

A fundamental duty of Congress is to ensure the federal government remains open and operational. 

Read my full statement on my vote to avert a government shutdown: 

https://t.co/NjsaBx1Xt7

I will be supporting the CR today because it’s a clean solution to continue essential services the American people depend upon.

More so, this resolution offers us a clear path to focus on advancing @POTUS agenda—securing our borders, identifying wasteful spending, and delivering results voters mandated in November.

It's been a fast-paced sprint in Washington, and we’re maintaining our stamina for the marathon ahead.

Check out my latest newsletter through the link below for the most current insights and key updates on CD-2 and developments in Washington, D.C.!

https://t.co/nNLNK4t9jA https://t.co/MdKGotTZud

It was great to catch up with this group! We must continue supporting our local broadcasters, who provide essential and timely news that keeps our communities informed about what’s happening around the world and safe during emergencies.

It was great seeing my good friend @Sec_Noem last week. I appreciate her stopping by my office to discuss the agency’s priorities for restoring order along our borders.

The past four years of reckless, open-border policies have wreaked havoc on American communities and undermined our national security.

I look forward to working together to ensure the Department of Homeland Security has the resources, manpower, and support needed to empower our border patrol agents and finally put an end to this crisis.

I had the honor of addressing @BBBSA before their advocacy day on Capitol Hill.

This organization plays a vital role in connecting positive mentors with young individuals in communities across our nation, making a direct and lasting impact on the lives of our next generation. https://t.co/Qkz6TdaWhY

The budget reconciliation blueprint seeks to provide $300 billion for border security and defense.

We’re finally prioritizing America's most essential asset: our national security.

As the @HouseAppropsGOP Homeland Security Chairman, I'm committed to delivering on this promise.

🚨🚨 My office is still accepting applications for the Spring 2025 internship program. Visit my website below to apply for this unique opportunity to learn more about our legislative process and expand your network in Washington, D.C.!

https://t.co/MRXUtebFms https://t.co/Z3JOkR2uv7

I reintroduced the PROTECT Act because no veteran, who made such selfless sacrifices for our nation, should have to move mountains to prove they are suffering as a result of their service.

Read my full statement for more information on this bill:

https://t.co/Od8ecbSdi9

Proud to be joined by @RepHorsford to reintroduce the Mining Regulatory Clarity Act, which strengthens our domestic mineral supply chains and restores stability in the mining permitting process that was undermined by the Rosemont Decision.

https://t.co/rKl0uunQas
Out West, we’re rich in natural resources that can be harnessed responsibly to reduce our reliance on adversaries, bolster our national security, and grow our economy.

Today, I reintroduced legislation that could save taxpayers millions of dollars each year by allowing the U.S. Mint to begin producing coins with more affordable materials.

Read my full statement:
https://t.co/KtaBOSG3aQ

Great meeting with @USBPChief today as we laid the groundwork for a plan of action to equip his officers with the resources they'll need to clean up the crisis at our borders.

I appreciate all the work he has done in such a short time and look forward to our continued partnership in securing our borders and strengthening our national security.

Before we jump into the “uncertainty and challenges” agencies may face as a result of this new administration’s policies, it’s important to address the real challenges they’ve faced for years—inability to meet staffing requirements to even execute these projects. 

Nevada is 85% owned and controlled by these agencies, the focus must be on securing resources to manage these lands effectively.

This week, the House passed two key pieces of legislation to defend our energy security and combat the fentanyl crisis running rampant in our communities. 

For a deeper dive into key developments like this, be sure to subscribe to my newsletter using the link below: 

https://t.co/Wvx7r5r3Rb

Today, we pause to reflect and remember the 6 million Jewish lives tragically lost during the Holocaust. 

We will never forget the atrocities that were committed and stand united in support and defense of our ally, Israel, ensuring such darkness is never repeated. https://t.co/9MfBe0QhAv

Happy Inauguration Day! 

America triumphantly selected Donald Trump to return to the White House as the 47th President. Our brightest days are ahead, and I look forward to working with his administration to advance a prosperous America First agenda!

Let’s get to work💪🇺🇸 https://t.co/jS6tdZVE66

I'm honored to reassume my role as Chairman of the House Appropriations Homeland Security Subcommittee. We will continue to find solutions to swiftly address the ongoing border crisis and provide the necessary resources to restore our nation's security. 

https://t.co/fUgSuCRfn9 https://t.co/Ap2Td18fF7

I joined @RepMaloyUtah to introduce legislation that curbs the executive branch’s overreach in designating national monuments. 

I believe the best lands policy comes from local communities who live off these lands, not Washington bureaucrats.

https://t.co/0m9lsEnKPY

This Congress, I’m thrilled to have a seat at the table on two influential @NatResources subcommittees like the Subcommittee on Federal Lands and the Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations. 

Read my full statement below: 

https://t.co/6jvzBaWdjo

Read my full statement regarding my vote to re-elect Rep. Mike Johnson to serve as Speaker of the House for the 119th Congress: 

https://t.co/CMEO6BdIB7

Today, we entered the 119th Congress. It’s an absolute honor to serve Nevada’s Second Congressional District.

Congratulations to @SpeakerJohnson on securing the gavel. I look forward to hitting the ground running to advance the America First agenda!🇺🇸 https://t.co/jvlqxbrA6m
